meaning_mnemonic:
<reading>Parrot, parrot</reading> (ペラペラ), your speaking is so <vocabulary>fluent</vocabulary>!

ペラペラ is an オノマトペ that describes someone speaking a language fluently, or simply being a real chatterbox.

Related to this, ペラペラ also means <vocabulary>leafing through a book</vocabulary>. And in an extension of that meaning, it can describe something <vocabulary>paper thin</vocabulary> or flimsy, like a piece of paper from that book you're leafing through.
